oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: First floor hall staircase of Belair house
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Interior view of the first floor hall at the Belair House, showing curving staircase, ceiling medallion and chandelier.
Federal architectural style home built in 1832 by John Harding as a wedding present to his daughter Elizabeth and her husband Joseph Clay.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Jones, Lester
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Entrance halls; Stairways; Medallions (Ornament areas); Chandeliers
